intro: Vittadinia gracilis, commonly known as slender vittadinia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Its slender stems and small, daisy-like flowers make it a distinctive species within its habitat. Vittadinia gracilis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
